page.title: 06FOWLSWICK FARM
page.content: {FOWLSWICK FARM}IS 4 K.M. N.W. OF CHIPPENHAM. FOWLSWICK FARM WAS BUILT IN THE{12th CENTURY}IT HAD A{MOAT AROUND THE FARM TO PROTECT IT. THE MOAT IS STILL THERE TODAY .THE FARM GETS ITS NAME FROM THE BIRDS WHO SWIM ON THE MOAT IN THE SUMMER .MR TAYLER WHO OWNS THE FARM IS AN ARABLE FARMER . HE GROWS WHEAT ,BARLEY AND POTATOES. MR TAYLER HAS 44 COWS .HE TAKES HIS COWS TO CHIPPENHAM CATTLE MARKET ON FRIDAYS .THE FARM HAS{80}ACRES OF LAND .MR TAYLER GETS UP AT 7.00 AM AND WORKS UNTILL 8.00 PM.HE HAS BEEN A FARMER FOR{15}YEARS AND HIS FARM HAS ENLARGED RECENTLY .MR TAYLER HAS NO FARM HANDS HE DOES THE WORK HIMSELF. THE FARM IS MENTIONED IN THE{ORIGINAL {DOMESDAY BOOK.
